Merge pull request #3 from flerda/v2.0.1-dev

A catch up of changes in my v2.0.1-dev branch
model byName() should be case sensitive (dae/old-libanki eda32b4f)
be tolerant of missing models when updating field cache (dae/old-libanki 8aa23c715)
work around usn upgrade issue (dae/old-libanki ea57f3293)
when copying a model over in import, make sure we flag it for sync (dae/old-libanki 322a2884)
preview should not reschedule cards (dae/old-ankiqt 74153f23bb)
remove unnecessary save() in sync (dae/old-ankiqt 3e6bb426a)
catch missing nids in fixIntegrity() (dae/old-libanki b226675618)
fix bug when renaming foo::bar foo to new parent (dae/old-libanki 4a00e0427)
don't log new cards in filtered deck as cramming (dae/old-libanki c36cc72cb2)
fix importing of latex cache files (dae/old-libanki 6e5233169)
improve handling of divergent models when importing (dae/old-libanki 3ffe47f5d) - Supplementary update adding _mungeMedia function in _importNotes that was missing from previous updates.
typo
earlier fix for logging new in filt broke logging of non-new in filt (dae/anki f6ff63eeb8)
strip HTML when calculating field checksum (users will need to checkDB) (dae/anki 2095e5c4b)
reapply failure mult on failures in lrn queue (dae/anki e27cbd2cb)
force full sync when restoring from backup (dae/anki 73f8d1a45)
import descriptions in parent decks (dae/anki c6b0945af)

allow browser font customization on a per-template basis (dae/anki d11a1e0d5) - Only the models default template is touched, the browser font is selected elsewhere in AD and doesn't follow the model currently.
spread reviews before sibling check (dae/anki 26ae5e1c47)
preserve image filenames when stripping html (dae/anki 8cf072c73)
don't indiscriminately modSchema on db check (dae/anki e9b24f9f3)
fix issues with clozes and <% %> (dae/anki 0447cb4f4)

Merge pull request #32 from iniju/v2.0.1-dev

Catch up merge from iniju into 2.0.1

make json serializations compatible with anki: Python's json.dumps()
function doesn't escape forward slashes when serializing. Android's
org.json.JSONObject.toString() function does escape them. That means
that when we save some card templates (frequently having tags that have
a forward slash when closing) we might be breaking them.
